title: A 3 Day Quick Tour of 2 Cities- Glimpse of Lanka the Paradise Isle
description:
Enjoy a captivating 3-day journey through the tropical island paradise
of Sri Lanka — a perfect blend of culture, history, and scenic beauty across Kandy
and Colombo.

days.title: Day 3 – Departure
days.description:
• Breakfast and leisure until transfer to the airport for onward flight.
Overview: Enjoy a captivating 3-day journey through the tropical island paradise
of Sri Lanka — a perfect blend of culture, history, and scenic beauty across Kandy
and Colombo.

days.title: Day 1 – Arrival / Kandy – The Cultural Heart
days.description:
• Meet & greet at Bandaranaike International Airport.
• Scenic drive through lush hill country to Kandy (approx. 3 hrs).
• En-route stops at Pinnawala Elephant Orphanage (optional) or local spice
gardens.
• Afternoon city tour of Kandy:
- Visit the Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic (UNESCO).
- Walk around Kandy Lake and explore the Bazaar and Gem Museum.
• Evening: enjoy a Traditional Cultural Dance Show.
• Overnight in Kandy. (Standard – Senani Hotel 4★ / Deluxe – Oak Ray Regency
5★)

days.title: Day 2 – Kandy → Colombo – The Vibrant Coastal Capital
days.description:
• Breakfast at hotel and morning visit to Royal Botanical Gardens – Peradeniya.
• Stop at Giragama Tea Factory for a tea experience and tasting.
• Depart for Colombo (approx. 3 hrs).
• Afternoon city tour:
- Galle Face Green Promenade
- Gangaramaya Temple and Viharamahadevi Park
- Independence Square, Red Mosque, and Lotus Tower view
• Leisure or shopping at Colombo City Centre / One Galle Face Mall.
• Overnight in Colombo. (Standard – Cinnamon Red 4★ / Deluxe – Cinnamon Grand
5★)

title: Day 1: Arrival  |Kandy, The Cultural Heart Meet and greet on arrival, then travel to Kandy

days.title: Day 1: Arrival  |Kandy, The Cultural Heart
days.description:
Meet and greet on arrival, then travel to Kandy
Visit Pinnawala Elephant Orphanage and enjoy time observing and feeding
the elephants
Explore the sacred Temple of the Tooth Relic, Kandy’s most iconic landmark
Stroll through the Royal Botanical Gardens and enjoy the calm, leafy
surroundings
Visit a spice village to learn about famous Ceylon spices and local remedies
Watch traditional handicrafts and batik making
Learn about Sri Lanka’s renowned gemstones and craftsmanship
If time permits, enjoy a traditional cultural dance show
Dinner and overnight stay in Kandy

days.title: Day 2: Kandy to Nuwara Eliya  |Little England in the Hills
days.description:
After breakfast, proceed to Nuwara Eliya
Optional scenic train ride from Kandy to Nuwara Eliya
En route, visit the Shri Bhakta Hanuman Hindu Temple near Ramboda
Stop at the beautiful Ramboda Waterfall for photos
Visit a tea garden and learn about Sri Lanka’s world-famous Ceylon tea
Visit Seetha Amman Hindu Kovil
Enjoy a peaceful walk at Gregory Park and admire Lake Gregory at sunset
Experience a classic high tea at the Grand Hotel
Dinner and overnight stay in Nuwara Eliya

days.title: Day 3: Nuwara Eliya to Bentota  |Beach, Nature, and
days.description:
River Safari
After breakfast at the hotel, travel to Bentota
Visit Lunuganga Estate, the stunning country home of world-famous architect
Geoffrey Bawa
Enjoy Bentota’s exciting water sports (optional): jet ski, banana boat, tube ride,
diving, snorkeling, and deep-sea fishing
Stop at the Kosgoda Turtle Hatchery to learn about Sri Lanka’s sea turtle
conservation
Take a scenic boat safari on the Madu River, gliding through beautiful
mangrove forests
Visit a fish farm on the river and, if you like, try the popular Sri Lankan fish
therapy
Explore the Moonstone mines and see how this unique gemstone is mined and
processed
Take a relaxing walk along the beach and enjoy a breathtaking sunset
Dinner and overnight stay at the hotel

days.title: Day 4: Bentota to Colombo  |City Highlights and
days.description:
Shopping
After breakfast at the hotel, proceed to Colombo
Visit the Gangaramaya Buddhist Temple and admire its unique blend of
modern design and cultural heritage
Enjoy a relaxing walk in a city park such as Green Path or Viharamahadevi
Park, with local artwork displayed along the roads
Explore the lively Colombo Fort area, including the bustling bazaar, the Red
Mosque, and the Dutch Museum
Stop at popular local hangout spots like Independence Square and the Arcade
at Independence Square
Visit the famous beachfront park Galle Face Green and view the Old
Parliament building nearby
Continue with shopping at top local spots such as ODEL, Noritake, House of
Fashion, Ceylon Tea Shops, and Sri Lankan handicraft stores
In the evening, enjoy Colombo’s nightlife with optional visits to local pubs,
clubs, and casinos
Sri Lanka
